result.execSummary:
The defendant Emanuel A McGruther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emanuel A McGruther in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion.  Atty Klopp states motion and asks that the jail sentence condition be reduced by 2 weeks and states reasons why.  
Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to deny the motion.
Atty Klopp makes arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.  Defendant gives a written statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant's motion is denied.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emanuel A McGruther in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel have received the PSI and are prepared to proceed today.  Atty Klopp states 1 correction.  
Atty Hendee makes sentencing arguments and recommends prison confinement and extended supervision.  
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments and recommends probation with a jail sentence.
BY THE COURT:
Ct 1:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 3 years.  Conditions:  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00.  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Maintain absolute sobriety.  *AODA and comply with recommendations.  *Obtain GED or HSED.  *Counseling as recommended by the agent.  *6 month DL suspension.

Ct 2:  Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent to Ct 1.  *Serve 9 months in the Marquette County Jail, commencing on or before 7/6/15, clean and sober.  Huber granted for work and child care.  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *6 month DL suspension.
 
 **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing at 06-04-2015 11:15 am

Defendant Emanuel A McGruther in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Klopp, the defendant wants to get a new sentencing date.  Atty Klopp states that today is the first day that he has been able to sit down with Mr. McGruther to go over the PSI.  
Atty Hendee has no objection to the reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Sentencing hearing at 05-20-2015 03:15 pm
Sentencing hearing at 04-23-2015 09:45 am
Sentencing hearing on April 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Counts 3, 4 & 5 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee states that parties will be requesting a PSI.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Atty Klopp asks the court to order a PSI.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.  Counts 3, 4 & 5 to be dismissed and read-in.
